CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. BHJ (mentioned twice)
2. PC61BM (mentioned once)
3. PC71BM (mentioned once)

So, the three material names mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. BHJ (Butyric acid)
2. PC61BM (6,6-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
3. PC71BM (6,6-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph after removing the irrelevant entities:

1. BHJ
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM

So, the three material names that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph are:

1. BHJ
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| BHJ |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! To identify the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph, we can follow these steps:

1. Identify the entities mentioned in the paragraph:

a. Power conversion efficiency
b. Polymer donor materials
c. Electron acceptors

2. Determine which of these entities are "Property Value" entities:

a. Power conversion efficiency - This is a property value entity because it is a measure of the efficiency of the solar cells.

b. Polymer donor materials - This is a property value entity because it refers to the type of polymer used in the solar cells, which affects their efficiency.

c. Electron acceptors - This is a property value entity because it refers to the type of material used in the solar cells to accept electrons and determine their efficiency.

Therefore, the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph are:

* Power conversion efficiency
* Polymer donor materials
* Electron acceptors
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. Power conversion efficiency - This is a measure of the efficiency of the solar cells, which is a material property.
2. Polymer donor materials - These are the types of polymers used in the solar cells, which can affect their efficiency.
3. Electron acceptors - These are the materials used in the solar cells to accept electrons, which can also affect their efficiency.

Therefore, the only "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Power conversion efficiency
2. Polymer donor materials
3. Electron acceptors

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Power conversion efficiency |
| Polymer donor materials |
| Electron acceptors |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
